command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: The New-APFDeployment function creates a new APF deployment based on the provided parameters.
Create a Intune package for the application. Default is false.
The folder where the files will be copied to. Default is the current directory.
Paths to any additional files that need to be included in the installation.
The switches to use when installing the application. Default is empty. You'll have to manually edit the configuration file.
The name of the application. This is written into the exported configuration files. If you do not provide a name, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file.
The path to the installer file. This should be a .msi or .exe file. This parameter is mandatory.
The target for the deployment, User context or System context. Default is 'system'.
The path to the uninstall file. Default is empty. You'll have to manually edit the configuration file.
The switches to use when uninstalling the application. Default is empty. You'll have to manually edit the configuration file.

The version of the application. This is written into the exported configuration files. This should be in the format of x.x.x.x. If you do not provide a version, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file.
Create a Intune package for the application. Default is false.
The folder where the files will be copied to. Default is the current directory.
Paths to any additional files that need to be included in the installation.
The switches to use when installing the application. Default is empty. You'll have to manually edit the configuration file.
The name of the application. This is written into the exported configuration files. If you do not provide a name, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file.
The path to the installer file. This should be a .msi or .exe file. This parameter is mandatory.
The target for the deployment, User context or System context. Default is 'system'.
The path to the uninstall file. Default is empty. You'll have to manually edit the configuration file.
The switches to use when uninstalling the application. Default is empty. You'll have to manually edit the configuration file.

The version of the application. This is written into the exported configuration files. This should be in the format of x.x.x.x. If you do not provide a version, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file.

maml:alert.maml:para: A folder is created withe name of the application containing all the files and configuration.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new APF deployment for an application named "MyApp" with version 1.0.0.0. The installer file is located at "C:\Installers\MyApp.msi", and the deployment files will be copied to "C:\Deployments\MyApp".

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Intune Application Deployment, automatically generating the .intunewin file and optionally the JSON file, and optionally publishing it

This PowerShell Advanced Function Creates a new Intune Application Deployment, this can either generate the .intunewin file and a json file describing the application or create the intunewin file and publish it directly to Intune.
The name of the application to be created.
This can be a list of files or a directory. If you specify a directory, the function will include all files in the directory and subdirectories.
The path to the image file for the application. Needs to be a PNG or JPG with a max resolution of 256x256 pixels.
The command to install the application.
The command to uninstall the application.
The requirement rule Config path for the application. A string of parsable requirements.
The assignment type for the application. Either User-Group, Device-Group, All-Users, All-Devices.
The group to assign the application to.
The filter rule for the application.
The path to the IntuneWinAppUtil.exe tool. If not specified the function will look for the tool in the current directory. If not found the function will download the tool from the internet.
The folder to save the .intunewin file and JSON config, current directory by default.
The description of the application. You can either pass a Markdown formatted file or a string.
Do not clean up the files after publishing.
Do not generate the JSON file.
Overwrite the .intunewin file and JSON if they already exists.
Publish the application directly to Intune.
The name of the application to be created.
The group to assign the application to.
The assignment type for the application. Either User-Group, Device-Group, All-Users, All-Devices.
The description of the application. You can either pass a Markdown formatted file or a string.
The filter rule for the application.
The command to install the application.
The path to the IntuneWinAppUtil.exe tool. If not specified the function will look for the tool in the current directory. If not found the function will download the tool from the internet.
The path to the image file for the application. Needs to be a PNG or JPG with a max resolution of 256x256 pixels.
Do not clean up the files after publishing.
Do not generate the JSON file.
The folder to save the .intunewin file and JSON config, current directory by default.
Overwrite the .intunewin file and JSON if they already exists.
Publish the application directly to Intune.
The requirement rule Config path for the application. A string of parsable requirements.
This can be a list of files or a directory. If you specify a directory, the function will include all files in the directory and subdirectories.
The command to uninstall the application.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-IntuneApplication -ApplicationName "7-Zip" -Description "7-Zip is a file archiver with a high compression ratio." -Publisher "7-Zip" -Version "19.00" -Developer "Igor Pavlov" -InstallCommand "msiexec /i 7z1900-x64.msi /qn" -UninstallCommand "msiexec /x 7z1900-x64.msi /qn" -RequirementRuleType "Config" -RequirementRuleConfig "OS: Windows 10" -DetectionRuleType "MSI" -LogoPath "C:\Program Files\7-Zip\7zFM.exe" -AssignmentType "All-Devices" -IntuneWinPath "C:\Temp\7-Zip" -Publish Creates a new Intune Application Deployment for 7-Zip, generates the .intunewin file, and publishes it to Intune.

The MSI operation type. If exists is selected then the operator and comparison value are not required.
The type of rule to create.
The registry operation type. If exists is selected then the operator and comparison value are not required.
The type of rule to create.
The registry value name to detect.
The path or file operation type. If exists is selected then the operator and comparison value are not required.

The script display name. Default will be file name.

The path to the MSI file.
The MSI operation type. If exists is selected then the operator and comparison value are not required.
The registry operation type. If exists is selected then the operator and comparison value are not required.
The type of rule to create.
The account type to run the requirements script as.
The registry value name to detect.

maml:description.maml:para: This function takes the .intunewin and configuration .json and publishes the application to Intune

This function takes the .intunewin and configuration .json and publishes the application to Intune. If the application already exists in Intune, the function will update the application if the -Force switch is used.
The path to the JSON file that contains the Intune Application configuration
If the application already exists in Intune, this switch will force the application to be updated.
If the application already exists in Intune, this switch will force the application to be updated.
The path to the JSON file that contains the Intune Application configuration

dev:type.maml:name: The function will output the Intune Application details that was created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will publish the application to Intune using the configuration in the JSON file and the .intunewin file.
